title: Common Correlated Effects Estimation of Nonlinear Panel Data Models. (arXiv:2304.13199v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: This paper focuses on estimating the coefficients and average partial effects of observed regressors in nonlinear panel data models with interactive fixed effects, using the common correlated effects (CCE) framework. The proposed two-step estimation method involves applying principal component analysis to estimate latent factors based on cross-sectional averages of the regressors in the first step, and jointly estimating the coefficients of the regressors and factor loadings in the second step. The asymptotic distributions of the proposed estimators are derived under general conditions, assuming that the number of time-series observations is comparable to the number of cross-sectional observations. To correct for asymptotic biases of the estimators, we introduce both analytical and split-panel jackknife methods, and confirm their good performance in finite samples using Monte Carlo simulations. An empirical application utilizes the proposed method to study the arbitrage behaviour of no

Title: Common Correlated Effects Estimation of Nonlinear Panel Data Models. (arXiv:2304.13199v1 [econ.EM])
Abstract: This paper focuses on estimating the coefficients and average partial effects of observed regressors in nonlinear panel data models with interactive fixed effects, using the common correlated effects (CCE) framework. The proposed two-step estimation method involves applying principal component analysis to estimate latent factors based on cross-sectional averages of the regressors in the first step, and jointly estimating the coefficients of the regressors and factor loadings in the second step. The asymptotic distributions of the proposed estimators are derived under general conditions, assuming that the number of time-series observations is comparable to the number of cross-sectional observations. To correct for asymptotic biases of the estimators, we introduce both analytical and split-panel jackknife methods, and confirm their good performance in finite samples using Monte Carlo simulations. An empirical application utilizes the proposed method to study the arbitrage behaviour of no
translated_title: 非线性面板数据模型的共同相关效应估计
translated_abstract: 本文将重点放在使用共同相关效应（CCE）框架对具有交互固定效应的非线性面板数据模型中观测到的回归器的系数和平均偏效应进行估计。所提出的两步估计方法包括在第一步中应用主成分分析以基于回归器的截面平均数估计潜在因素，并在第二步中联合估计回归器和因子载荷的系数。在一般条件下导出所提出的估计量的渐近分布，假设时间序列观测值的数量与横向观测值的数量相当。为了纠正估计器 随着时间变化的渐近偏差，我们引入了分析和分裂面板抽样方法，并使用蒙特卡罗模拟来确认它们在有限的样本中的良好性能。一个实证应用运用所提出的方法来研究无套利行为的行为。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于CCE框架，通过两个步骤分别进行主成分分析和联合估计来估计非线性面板数据模型中观测到的回归器的系数和平均偏效应的方法，并介绍了用于纠正估计器随时间变化的渐近偏差的分析和分裂面板抽样方法。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a method based on the CCE framework to estimate the coefficients and average partial effects of observed regressors in nonlinear panel data models through two steps of principal component analysis and joint estimation, and introduces analytical and split-panel jackknife methods to correct for asymptotic biases of the estimators over time, which is confirmed by Monte Carlo simulations. An empirical application studies the arbitrage behaviour of no.
